author: {'steamid': '76561197970370382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1624744448}
review: Feeble Saga isn't that bad (EAaccess). I take it like a throw back to old PS2 gaming. It's not perfect by any means. The story is very partial. The combat is simplistic and unprecise at times. There is only one speed in terms of running. There are some problems of collision detection. Still it's fun to explore and upgrade the character, and having a very simple fighting experience. The levels are almost isometric and they have good vegetations/items. Not every quest is pointed on the map, especially when they are resolve. That demands some memory. I give it 68%. I don't know if that game will be finished or not, but it is a nice one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013728022', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1613081197}
review:
I like it. I like it a lot. Not much going for it, but I think that works to it's advantage - this is a fantasy action RPG that gets down to brass tacks and I found myself thinking 'this is a game that could easily be a practice run for first-time or younger RPG gamers'. It teaches you about upgrading your gear, and there's a nice balance of figuring things out for yourself in a quest, and also being guided through the objective.

Criticisms include jerky animation, a dodge/roll move that you'll miss if you blink (although repeatedly rolling does give you a speed boost!). Way too many of those tusk-beasts around, and while the squeak of a rat may work in a dungeon... spying those tusks in miniature form breaks the illusion. It's cool to see some armoured variants though!

I'd really like to see this game grow, it's an excellent homage to cult classics like the Bard's Tale or Rune. I actually did a small livestream of the game! twitch.tv/roboprimegames - but I'm also on YouTube where you can catch the VOD :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073435460', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1593550059}
review:
Mouais... En l'état, malgré un prix vraiment modique, je ne peux le recommander.
Il est trop faible sur de nombreux points, à savoir, la maniabilité du personnage, la répétitivité des tactiques pour vaincre les adversaires, l'impossibilité de redéfinir les touches de contrôles, l'histoire peu galvanisante, les quêtes secondaires assez plates et les personnages qui manquent cruellement de caractère.

Par ailleurs, la faible évolutivité du personnage qui consiste quasi exclusivement en une augmentation des points de vie et une amélioration de l'équipement fait plutôt de ce jeu, un jeu d'action plus qu'un RPG, de mon point de vue.

Autre problème : les  mêmes monstres qui réapparaissent au même endroit et en même quantité à chaque fois qu'on recharge une zone. Je veux bien que les monstres réapparaissent mais pas dans toutes les zones et pas  à chaque fois de la même manière...

Il aurait bien des qualités mais elles sont pour l'instant eclipsées par les trop nombreux défauts et l'ennui qui finit par survenir après les premières heures de jeu.

Une note : 10/20 en l'état, en espérant qu'il sera grandement amélioré pour me faire changer d'avis. En tout cas, il est tellement peu cher que, si vous avez un doute, vous pouvez aussi l'acquérir pour vous faire votre propre idée.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329056532', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1592260707}
review:
I want to like this game- I really appreciate people making things available for Mac. However I'm immediately having issues that need resolving. 

First (and I've a screenshot of this), in character creation there was a giant black box coving my character so I couldn't see them- I had to pick options by going in and out of the character creation menu- which thankfully allowed me to see at least a tiny bit of what i was doing. At the end of character creation, the button weirdly duplicated to make about 10 of the same character to select from. 

Second, the portrait of my character in the upper left near my stats looks nothing like my character. 

Third, and most importantly, upon clicking to enter the guild hall, I was stuck on a loading screen for 10 minutes- so I force quit the game. This is why my play time is so low. 

Bonus problem- the health potion in my inventory had a visual glitch. 

I'm definitely going to try again, I know this is in early access still and I like what little I've seen and heard of the visual style and music. I will certainly update this review if it turns out the problems were some strange anomaly, but I can't currently recommend this, at least not on a Mac (I note other people are playing fine and I haven't seen posts about the character creation issue).  

Edit- not just the guild hall, any building will cause me to be stuck on the loading screen until I force quit. Gonna have to return this one- completely unplayable.
developer_response:
EDIT: The loading bug is fixed. Update to get the fix! Also I couldn't reproduce Mac display issue. Please submit screenshots to the forums or email support@wasatch.games.

Before returning, please consider posting your bugs with screenshots in the discussion forums. The loading bug will be fixed shortly and there is a temporary fix for it in the forum. I'm not sure about the display issues on Mac since I can't easily test those, but I'll look into them soon. Thank you for your patience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026076362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1587595221}
review:
Genuinely one of the best little things I've mucked about in in a long time - going in understanding it was an indie game doesn't do it justice.

It's really much more entertaining than that. It's a lot more worthwhile than that.

I won't say *too* much, but noting that your character snarkily writes notes into the journal as you do quests was cute. The dialogue is nice, where seen, and there's a lot of time and effort notable in a variety of areas; I found myself wandering around aimlessly simply because I could, and because I might find something somewhere to interest me. Finding NPCs or hidden chests or sidequests, or heck, just random mini-bosses, was always a nice little touch.

You can make it easier on yourself if you grind, but it isn't necessary; the items you get from chests don't hinder your movement speed nor did I find them lacking in providing moderate defense, and none of it's exactly necessary if you learn to time your little dodge rolls. (Sidenote; fun to roll around. I genuinely find how fast the character just Sonics into a roll and then up back into its slightly clunky normal state to be rather amusing. 10/10, spent the entirety of dungeon-delving rolling and I hold no regrets.) Still, the extra grind and investment, as mobs respawn when you re-enter a zone, is worthwhile and there are items that definitely make it easier. (Though, I *do* recommend holding off on grinding until you discover the bandits and onward, as they are actually semi-worth farming if you've been having a tough time.)

I've yet to try the spears, but the swords and mace I picked up were interesting and their power attacks were pretty neato. Light attacks are superior, of course, but the heavies are unique and are great for clearing mobs that can't penetrate your armor. Speed factors in, too, though not insanely as from what I can tell, though I do prefer the quicker weapons for the better swing-and-dodge strat.

All in all, I dunno' what else to say; I have had this in my library for a while, went and played it today whilst in a kind of poor mood, and found a game I intend to invest far more time in exploring and working at as, at the time of writing this, three dedicated hours has not gotten me to the whole of the game nor all of the weapons yet. For something I discovered was 5$ still, I can't say that that's a bad price at all.

If anything, it's generous.

The only complaint?
I hate the projectile mobs. Looking at you, catacomb wizard man... thing... Whatever.


TL;DR - It's a good game, it's not terribly grindy, the controls are easily manageable, the dialogue is fun, the characters are well-written, and the price is easily cheap for what you're getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042113623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1561735231}
review:
its a cute little half-serious rpg that reminds me of my childhood playing games like Dark Alliance and Bard's Tale and other older RPGs, and its honestly pretty fun despite how bare bones many mechanics are;

However, as a fervent history nutcase, one thing drives me crazy.
The weapons.
They give real historical names to all the weapons, and then have the models have..... nothing close to the weapon theyre using the name of. its deeply odd. A falchion is a single-handed knightly sword like youd normally picture, but with a single edged broader blade for cutting unarmored targets better, in this its some weird large curved sword.
A Kris is a breathtakingly beautiful wavy sword from the philipines that i constantly question why is left out from fantasy because it looks like the epitome of all things elven, and this game has a sword called the 'kris'. The kris in the game, however, if a flamberge *greatsword*..... scaled down to the size of a knife in your hand. Which looks.... a little bit hilarious.
Longsword just means 'two handed sword.' The longsword in this game definitely isnt that and its description is 'maybe a little bit too long' if that gives you any indication.
A b*stard sword is literally a shortened longsword designed to be usable in one or two hands depending on the situation - all non-greatswords in dark souls, for example, are actually bastard swords because of how theyre all designed to switch from one to two hands. The description of a b*stard is "Only the finest barbarians can wield this monstrous weapon"

Its just... odd. It confuses me on a deep, and spiritual level (im joking, if you cant tell.) Why go through the effort of finding so many real historical weapons and nomenclatures if you're then going to seemingly go out of your way to make them as wrong as possible?
Is this just a jab at history nuts like me to drive us insane?
Maybe, hell if it were i'd buy the devs a cookie cause thats clever as f*ck.


Anyways, sword rant over, its a cool little game for cheap, and i do recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189184277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1604662248}
review:
As with all early access games, there's much to be done with A Feeble Saga, but where many other early access games fail to deliver or otherwise not be what you expected it to be, A Feeble Saga delivers. I went into the game thinking I would not be playing it that much, I ended up spending 4 hours and really enjoyed those hours. There's not many quests, but the exploration is a large part of the game, and that's how I managed to spend 4 hours instead of just 1. I recommend this game, because what the solo developer has done up until now is just a small part of what is to come. Buy it now before it becomes expensive :p

Edit: This game is pretty much dead, and sadly, there weren't many additions after I wrote my review, which was disappointing. Changed recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042591142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1622152099}
review: This is my first ever review. I bought the game yesterday evening. It's now 3am and I have to be up at 7am. I am obviously thoroughly enjoying it. I like bespoke (rather than generated) dungeons. The combat is a bit basic but I don't like learning loads of combos so I'm happy. Don't be fooled; there is subtly to the combat. If you use a slow high DPS sword against a skeleton then it will hit you twice (hard) before you take it down, so you have to use a faster lighter sword. I have probably bought and used more than the usual number of potions which is maybe why my equipment is making the skeletons rather a challenge but then I discovered you can harvest bushes for coins, so now I can always have a few more health potions handy (you could harvest 2000 bushes to get enough money to buy top end equipment before you leave the village if that's the way you like to play - but please don't as you will turn the game into little more than a walkthough for yourself). This is a modest, inexpensive, enjoyable game. I recommend it and I look forward to further updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035697801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1557458023}
review:
Its not the money that's a problem, its the hours that I will never get back. Since when is being an adventurer the same as being a gardener? I made more money chopping down bushes than adventuring. Because the bshes repopulate any time you leave a screen and come back, you could make enough money to buy all the high end gear before ever fighting a monster. 

The game mechanics are horribly simple, press a key to swing. No blocking, no need to time attacks, just keep clicking the mouse. Boring.
developer_response: Since you posted this review, there have been many updates to the game to improve the experience. Including changes to make combat more exciting and balancing currency rewards. And while you can still hack at the respawning bushes to get gold, it would take much, much longer than just playing the game for real. There are also a ton more areas to explore, and quests to complete. Anyway, I encourage you to play again and hope you can enjoy the changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824017237', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 286, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1554670229}
review:
[h1] Featured in my Lost on Steam Episode 6! [/h1]

Rather just check the video instead of read? Me too:
https://youtu.be/o27cvILIlHo

I started a new short segment called "Lost on Steam" which features games that have few reviews for one reason or another. Definitely not necessarily negative, just games that slipped by people.

This is one of the featured games this week! 

A Feeble Saga is game that could be much more than it is. It suffers from a really bland selection of monsters and a rather confusing map / exploration system. Combat is EXTREMELY basic having not much more than a slice to attack monsters, no matter the weapon you're using.

Exploration feels tedious and the areas to explore aren't anything noteworthy. Honestly the project feels a little too ambitious for the people that made it. If combat were more involved I could rate it higher and look past the issues, but it's not.

tl;dr - Combat is too simple. Game is too tedious. Needs a lot of work before a worthy release happens.


An unboxing for video games!  You can watch the highlights of this game and the two others featured this week here:
https://youtu.be/o27cvILIlHo

Join the Curator group for more review like this: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34634494/

author: {'steamid': '76561198008485568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1612803854}
review:
It's been 9 months since my review, and it is time to edit. i left what i wrote at that time so you can see the game improves
You can now buy armor, you can block with your shield and fighting has overall improved.
The area of the game has grown. There are new quests.
Updates come slow, but the dev is honest about it, and honest about doing the things he promises. I still enjoy myself when  I come back to see how it fares.Still recommended.



The game is oldfashioned simple hack and slash. There isn't yet a lot of content, but what there is worked flawlessly on my rig. 
The fighting is very simple and you can't block with your shield, but the dev has promised that will be implemented.
The sword you have from the beginning is..yes..feeble! You can hardly manage the smallest critters, but you can attack bushes, and there is a lot of bushes, and they will drop money and hearts, which are a tiny bit of healing. Soon you can buy a better sword, and you can kill more critters and reach some small caves where you can smash barrels that have money and hearts. After a while you can get an even better sword and perhaps a shield, and then you are good to go adventuring. You can't buy armor yet. But if you explore you might find chests that has some armor.
You don't get xp, finding chests that holds bigger hearts that will improve you health, is, at least so far, the only way to get stronger.
I find the game charming and entertaining, and for that very cheap price, it is definately a recommended from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847803117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1662535839}
review: I like the gameplay and graphics a lot - it's very reminiscent of my favorite RPG/Dungeon Crawler, FATE, which is sadly only available for Windows platforms (so I've had to use BootCamp to install and run it). However, it's obviously a new game and could use some tweaking. I saw that the developer replied to a comment regarding the difficulty with keeping track of your location, so I'm awaiting the update that'll add a map to the game. There's another issue relating to location: when you die, you start from REALLY far behind where you ended at. I got to a cemetery deep in the woods and started back at the gate between the town and the woods after dying. Perhaps the developer could add some slightly more frequent checkpoints so we're not always starting back at square one? I think this game would benefit from the addition of some more elements from any of the FATE games. For instance, I immediately noticed that this game has no female avatars available. In FATE, you get to choose a male or female character, customize it, and select a pet dog or cat as a companion and fighting partner. There's also a lack of items available to buy from shops and traveling salesmen. I'd like to see some variety (and maybe some magical items, if that's possible). Last thing - when you use a portal to go back to town and you come back, the monsters and bandits you already killed are back somehow. It'd be nice if they'd just stay dead. It seems like a waste of time killing what was already dead a second time. Even though this game could use some work, I recommend that other fans of RPGs, Dungeon Crawlers, and Adventure/Quest games give it a try. I'm enjoying it despite its flaws. (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198106662925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1704396526}
review: Fun for me  ,runs great looks good enough and has some humor to boot . For an EA title and 5 bucks think off to a good start and look forward to seeing what they have in mind .You can see areas under work so there will be more content in the future. I have been messing around and have 8 hours in and only 50% complete on quest log . Happy Gaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198033727524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1648144006}
review:
mmmmmm if only we good give a in between thumbs up as for me its in between. At present its a no.
Very early early pre the evolution of man game, basic, hack and slash with very little skill or tactics involved. Bash bushes or barrels for coins or hearts to boast up your health. Set linear quests, bash mobs until you reach the big boss, ohh dear one hit im dead, bash more bushes to get more loot to buy a greater DPS blade, go back to boss, two hits he is dead.
repeat, rinse, repeat.
Few side quests, I mean few. Chose your character face - no female, has no meaning in the game, cant change stats, cant buy armour yet. This game needs a lot of work and wont be ready for loooong time yet me thinks. I will keep bashing away and watch how the developer progresses.  Will now go have a long sleep.
developer_response: I would like to inform you that there have been many updates to improve the issues you had with the game. I hope you see this and return one day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076251308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1552332767}
review:
I can't really say, at this point, if its 'worth' the cost. 6(ish) bucks for 1 single hour(if that) of total play, already beat all available quests and there's nothing left to do. But considering they are still working on it, it could be worth (the current price) it in the long run.

It needs some work, but it does have promise, so yea I would recommend (again, at this price, and again, if its not just vaporware) this for an hour if you have a few bucks sitting in your wallet doing nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040421250', 'num_games_owned': 19550, 'num_reviews': 743, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1551906043}
review:
In this video I take a look at A Feeble Saga a hack'n'slash RPG adventure game. I got sucked into this game for longer than I had expected and it's really quite good. I mean don't expect amazing quality because it does have it's draw backs but at the price it is it's well worth playing and you will easily get your moneys worth out of it. I really enjoyed it but some camera controls and a map would be good.
Watch the video to see what the game is like for yourself.....
https://youtu.be/7QkWhOr0D-Q
Check'n Games, providing you with as many Let's Play's as we can.
Thanks for watching. Please like comment and subscribe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321620389', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1573968703}
review:
I will try any game, but if that game keeps me wanting to play and restarting over and over every time I get something wrong or die, that is a game worth it. This game, had me addicted, wanting to keep playing, to see what happens next, to keep exploring, everything a game is supposed to do. 
The game starts off exactly as it's described, a village in need of a hero to take care of some of the dirty work. The quests and story take off from there, keeping you wondering what's next. Taking a step back and considering organization while questing comes in handy, but isn't a necessity. Exploring the area and the village is defnitely a plus to get the most out of the story lines of the villagers. At first the respawning trash mobs seemed like a bug or something that shouldn't happen, but after a few minutes, you realize the respawns add variety, currency, and occupation to the game play. The graphics are great, the game play is eventful,  I can't wait to see what else gets added, I'll keep checking the updates and twitter.

This product was received through a third party website for free, my recommendation and opinion is based on game play alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067811810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1551887894}
review: Nett gemacht, mehr aber auch nicht. Für die Ansprüche der heutigen Gamer-Generation definitiv zu schlicht. Tja, der Preis von knapp 4,-€ sagt da eigentlich schon alles. Absolute Fast-Food Daddelei ohne Tiefgang aber dafür mit grauenhafter Kameraführung und Bedienung. Gefühlsmäßig eher ein Handy-Game als denn ein PC Titel. Für gerade mal 1,-€ mehr kann man sich im Netz Torchlight 1 kaufen. Ich denke, da ist man auf jeden Fall besser bedient.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992660067', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1652206844}
review:
Disclaimer: I am a friend and associate of the developer

Summary:
Feeble Saga is a short and simple adventure experience that will appeal to old school gamers who are tired of some of the fluff and hand holding that comes with modern games. That being said it is also approachable to slightly more "new school" gamers like myself.

Feeble saga is a short and simple adventure game. Although at first look you may want to compare it to loot fest dungeon crawlers like Diablo or Titan Quest it is much more comparable to something like the 2D Zelda games and has a lot of old school vibe to its design. There is no leveling system and monster drops are primary currency and hearts. As long as you know what to expect and that is your thing this game is a fun little adventure! 

Obtaining new weapons and shields in the shop gives you a very noticeable feeling of progression when battling monsters. Combat is simple but manages to be challenging and interesting. It's variety comes from the variety in attack speed of both your weapons and enemies. In order to succeed later in the game you will really need to memorize the "attack patterns" of your enemies to avoid taking damage.

Feeble Saga does away with some of the hand holding that often comes with modern RPGs. There is no quest tracker or compass so you will actually have to pay attention to the instructions of the quest givers in order to complete your tasks. To many this will be a much appreciated feature. I generally don't mind hand holding but even I (a gamer with a horrible sense of direction) was able to complete all the quests without too much difficulty and found that I enjoyed having to slow down and actually pay attention, rather than just mindlessly follow arrows and hitting stuff.

At the time of this review I was able to play through the game in about 3 hours including all side quests. I can be a bit of a baddie at times so you could probably get through it quicker but I think this will be fairly normal for most. Personally I'm at a stage in my life where I don't have time for 60 hour  mondo campaigns so although I look forward to a few more side quests I think a shorter run-time is actually a strength and I felt like I had time to slow down and talk to all the villagers and take in as much of the game world as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422627', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 1237, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1551225239}
review:
Nice little indie RPG and I'd say is worth the price tag as long as you don't go into it expecting Diablo 4 or Dragon Age Origins.  It's a fine little indie RPG and I found it pretty fun.

I'd love to see the developer add a use for the right mouse button in the form of a quick side jump or roll to dodge or heck just make it use an equipped shield to block attacks.  

I found a few more little issues nitpicking about minor potential exploits some players may use and my first experience can be best seen by watching this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q8meP0uFCZc&feature=youtu.be

I give the game an overall 8 out of 10 and say it's worth the price of admission.  

* I want to thank the developer for the free evaluation key, but understand that free Steam keys NEVER alter my opinion or score of any game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198917118170', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1551227863}
review: Right from the start the game feels cheap and basic. The fact that it only cost £3.99 means you get what you pay for. Nothing to lose to try it, you might like it, it just wasn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037090154', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1551207982}
review:
Auf den ersten Blick wirkt das Spiel gut.
Bietet noch nicht ganz so viel: was ich vor allem vermisse ist eine Karte.
Story: joa, scheint auf den ersten Blick erstmal nichts tiefgründigeres zu sein! Man steht vor seinem Haus und möchte ein Held werden und geht deswegen zur Abenteurer Gilde. Soweit so gut.
Läuft flüssig mit 60FPS ist aber nicht das schönste Spiel des Jahrtausends - es ist stabil
Vom Kampfsystem/Gameplay errinert das ganze an alte Hack n Slay Titel ala D2 oder Titan Quest - allerdings! Lenkt man mit WASD und nicht mit per Mausklick. Der Mausklick dient lediglich zum zuschlagen wobei man dafür auch den E Knopf nutzen kann wenn man will. Ob man noch Zauber oder zumindest andere Kampffähigkeiten bekommt wäre Wünschenwert. 
Ansonsten guck ich so in das Spiel auf jedenfall nochmal rein und werde es weiterspielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038688147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1552000589}
review:
Very fun so far even though I've mostly been getting money by chopping bushes lol.

No character customization.  You choose a "Picture" and name your person but otherwise you are a blonde haired male "Hero" in the making.

Graphics are just like what the videos and screenshots show.  Full controller support.  There are no controller settings though so there is no option to remap keys.

If you like RPGs then this game is definitely worth picking up, especially considering the small price.

Seems to have been abandoned by the developers as no updates in several years.
